title: test time failed
body:
by **duedl0r**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. install Go using ./all.bash
2.
3.

What is the expected output?
ALL TESTS PASSED

What do you see instead?
gotest -test.short -test.timeout=120
rm -f _test/time.a
8g  -o _gotest_.8 format.go sleep.go sys.go tick.go time.go  sys_posix.go
zoneinfo_posix.go zoneinfo_unix.go
rm -f _test/time.a
gopack grc _test/time.a _gotest_.8
--- FAIL: time_test.TestAfterTick (1.93 seconds)
        10 ticks of 1e+08 ns took 1.932165e+09 ns, expected 1e+09
FAIL
gotest: "./8.out -test.short=true -test.timeout=120" failed: exit status 1

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
8g

Which operating system are you using?
Linux 2.6.23-gentoo-r3

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
c1702f36df03 (release-branch.r60) release/release.r60.3

Please provide any additional information below.
